==Events==
*[[585 BC]] &ndash; [[Lucius Tarquinius Priscus]], king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates a [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for his [[Roman-Sabine wars#War with Tarquinius Priscus|victories]] over the [[Sabines]], and the surrender of [[Collatia]].
*[[509 BC]] &ndash; The [[Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus]] on Rome's [[Capitoline Hill]] is dedicated on the [[Roman calendar|ides]] of September.
* [[335]] &ndash; Emperor [[Constantine the Great]] consecrated the [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]] in [[Old City (Jerusalem)|Jerusalem]].
* [[379]] [[Yax Nuun Ayiin I]] is coroneted as 15 [[Ajaw]] of [[Tikal]] 
* [[533]] &ndash; [[Belisarius]] of the [[Byzantine Empire]] defeats [[Gelimer]] and the [[Vandals]] at the [[Battle of Ad Decimum]], near [[Carthage]], North Africa.
*[[1229]] &ndash; [[Ögedei Khan]] is proclaimed [[Khagan]] of the [[Mongol Empire]] in Kodoe Aral, Khentii: [[Mongolia]].
*[[1501]] &ndash; [[Michelangelo]] begins work on his statue of [[David (Michelangelo)|David]].
*[[1504]] &ndash; [[Isabella I of Castile|Queen Isabella]] and [[Ferdinand II of Aragon|King Ferdinand]] issue a ''Royal Warrant'' for the construction of a Royal Chapel ([[Royal Chapel of Granada|Capilla Real]]) to be built.
*[[1541]] &ndash; After three years of exile, [[John Calvin]] returns to [[Geneva]] to reform the church under a body of doctrine known as [[Calvinism]].
*[[1584]] &ndash; [[San Lorenzo del Escorial Palace]] in [[Madrid]] is finished.
*[[1609]] &ndash; [[Henry Hudson]] reaches the river that would later be named after him &ndash; the [[Hudson River]].
*[[1743]] &ndash; Great Britain, Austria and the [[Kingdom of Sardinia]] sign the [[Treaty of Worms (1743)|Treaty of Worms]].
*[[1759]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Plains of Abraham]]: the British defeat the French near [[Quebec City]] in the [[Seven Years' War]], known in the United States as the [[French and Indian War]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: Franco-Spanish troops launch the unsuccessful "grand assault" during the [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]].
*[[1788]] &ndash; The [[Philadelphia Convention]] sets the date for the first presidential election in the United States, and New York City becomes the country's temporary capital.
*[[1791]] &ndash; King [[Louis XVI of France]] accepts the [[French Constitution of 1791|new constitution]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Finnish War]]: In the [[Battle of Jutas]], Swedish forces under [[Lieutenant General]] [[Georg Carl von Döbeln]] beat the [[Russian Empire|Russians]], making von Döbeln a Swedish [[hero|war hero]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: A supply wagon sent to relieve [[Siege of Fort Harrison|Fort Harrison]] is ambushed in the [[Battle of Fort Harrison#Attacks at the Narrows|Attack at the Narrows]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; In a turning point in the War of 1812, the British fail to capture [[Baltimore]]. During the battle, [[Francis Scott Key]] composes his poem "Defence of Fort McHenry", which is later set to music and becomes [[The Star-Spangled Banner|the United States' national anthem]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; The [[Greek Army]] [[3 September 1843 Revolution|rebels]] ([[Old Style and New Style dates|OS date]]: September 3) against the autocratic rule of king [[Otto of Greece]], demanding the granting of a constitution.
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: Six teenage military [[cadet]]s known as [[Niños Héroes]] die defending [[Chapultepec Castle]] in the [[Battle of Chapultepec]]. American troops under General [[Winfield Scott]] capture Mexico City in the Mexican–American War.
*[[1848]] &ndash; Vermont railroad worker [[Phineas Gage]] survives a {{convert|3|ft|m|adj=on}}-plus iron rod being driven through his head; the reported effects on his behavior and personality stimulate thinking about the nature of the brain and its functions.
*[[1850]] &ndash; First ascent of [[Piz Bernina]], the highest summit of the eastern Alps.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] soldiers find a copy of [[Robert E. Lee]]'s battle plans in a field outside [[Frederick, Maryland]]. It is the prelude to the [[Battle of Antietam]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Tel el-Kebir]] is fought in the [[Anglo-Egyptian War (1882)|Anglo-Egyptian War]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Hannibal Goodwin]] patents [[celluloid]] [[photographic film]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Henry Bliss (road accident victim)|Henry Bliss]] is the first person in the United States to be killed in an automobile accident.
*  1899   &ndash; [[Halford Mackinder|Mackinder]], Ollier and Brocherel make the first ascent of Batian (5,199 m &ndash; 17,058&nbsp;ft), the highest peak of [[Mount Kenya]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Filipino people|Filipino]] resistance fighters defeat a small American [[Column (formation)|column]] in the [[Battle of Pulang Lupa]], during the [[Philippine–American War]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; First flight of a [[fixed-wing aircraft]] in Europe.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: South African troops open hostilities in German south-west Africa ([[Namibia]]) with an assault on the Ramansdrift [[police station]].
*  1914   &ndash; World War I: The [[First Battle of the Aisne|Battle of Aisne]] begins between Germany and France.
*[[1922]] &ndash; The final act of the [[Greco-Turkish War (1919–22)|Greco-Turkish War]], the [[Great Fire of Smyrna]], commences.
*[[1923]] &ndash; Following a [[military coup]] in Spain, [[Miguel Primo de Rivera]] takes over, setting up a [[dictatorship]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth McCombs]] becomes the first woman [[Lyttelton by-election, 1933|elected]] to the [[Parliament of New Zealand|New Zealand Parliament]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Rockslide]] near [[Whirlpool Rapids Bridge]] ends the [[International Railway (New York–Ontario)]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Second day of the [[Battle of Edson's Ridge]] in the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]]. [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine]]s successfully defeated attacks by the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] with heavy losses for the Japanese forces.
*[[1943]] &ndash; The [[Municipal Theatre of Corfu]] is destroyed during an aerial bombardment by [[Luftwaffe]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; Deputy Primer Minister of India [[Vallabhbhai Patel]] ordered the Army to move into the [[Hyderabad State|Hyderabad]] to integrate it with [[Indian Union]].
*  1948   &ndash; [[Margaret Chase Smith]] is elected [[senator]], and becomes the first woman to serve in both the U.S. [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]] and the [[United States Senate]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Nikita Khrushchev]] is appointed [[secretary-general]] of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[Dike (construction)|dike]] around the Dutch [[polder]] [[Zuiderzee Works#The Flevolands|East Flevoland]] is closed.
*  1956   &ndash; The [[IBM 305 RAMAC]] is introduced, the first commercial computer to use [[disk storage]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[ARVN|South Vietnamese]] Generals [[Lâm Văn Phát]] and [[Dương Văn Đức]] fail in a [[September 1964 South Vietnamese coup attempt|coup attempt]] against General [[Nguyễn Khánh]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Albania]] leaves the [[Warsaw Pact]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; State police and [[United States National Guard|National Guardsmen]] storm New York's [[Attica Prison]] to end a [[Attica Prison riot|prison revolt]].
*  1971   &ndash; People's Republic of China: Chairman [[Mao Zedong]]'s second in command and successor Marshal [[Lin Biao]] flees the country via plane after the failure of alleged coup against Mao. The plane crashes in [[Mongolia]], killing all aboard.
*[[1979]] &ndash; South Africa grants independence to the "homeland" of [[Venda]] (not recognised outside South Africa).
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Goiânia accident]]: A [[radioactive]] object is stolen from an abandoned hospital in [[Goiânia]], Brazil, contaminating many people in the following weeks and causing some to die from [[radiation poisoning]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Gilbert]] is the strongest recorded hurricane in the Western Hemisphere, later replaced by [[Hurricane Wilma]] in [[2005]] (based on [[barometric pressure]]).
*[[1989]] &ndash; Largest anti-[[Apartheid]] march in South Africa, led by [[Desmond Tutu]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; Israeli Prime Minister [[Yitzhak Rabin]] shakes hands with [[PLO]] chairman [[Yasser Arafat]] at the [[White House]] after signing the [[Oslo Accords]] granting limited Palestinian autonomy.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Ulysses probe]] passes the Sun's south pole.
*[[2001]] &ndash; Civilian aircraft traffic resumes in the United States after the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Kimveer Gill]] kills one student and injures 19 more in the [[Dawson College shooting]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; The [[Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples]] is adopted by the [[United Nations General Assembly]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Delhi]], India, is hit by a [[13 September 2008 Delhi bombings|series of bomb blasts]], resulting in 30 deaths and 130 injuries.
*  2008   &ndash; [[Hurricane Ike]] makes landfall on the [[Texas]] [[Gulf Coast of the United States]], causing heavy damage to [[Galveston Island]], [[Houston]] and surrounding areas.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Taliban]] insurgents [[2013 attack on U.S. consulate in Herat|attack the United States consulate in Herat]], [[Afghanistan]], with two members of the [[Afghan National Police]] reported dead and about 20 civilians injured.
